content.heading: HTML HSL and HSLA Colors
paragraphs: HSL stands for hue, saturation, and lightness. HSLA color values are an extension of HSL that includes an Alpha channel for opacity.

content.heading: HSL Color Values
paragraphs: In HTML, a color can be specified using HSL in the form: hsl(hue, saturation, lightness).
Hue is a degree on the color wheel from 0 to 360: 0 is red, 120 is green, and 240 is blue.
Saturation is a percentage; 0% means gray, and 100% is the full color.
Lightness is also a percentage; 0% is black, and 100% is white.

content.heading: Saturation
paragraphs: Saturation describes the intensity of a color: 100% is pure color, 50% is half gray, and 0% is completely gray.

content.heading: Lightness
paragraphs: Lightness indicates how much light to give the color: 0% is black, 50% is normal, and 100% is white.

content.heading: Shades of Gray
paragraphs: Shades of gray are defined by setting hue and saturation to 0, adjusting lightness from 0% to 100%.
